advice.1: Try taking a warm bath or shower before bed. This might encourage beneficial temperature changes in your body.
advice.2: Avoid eating too late in the day. This will ensure that your body has plenty of time to digest your last meal.
advice.3: Exercising is crucial to hormone regulation, increasing levels of serotonin and decreasing cortisol.
advice.4: It is highly recommended that you stop using electronic devices, at least thirty minutes before bed.
advice.5: Aromatherapy can improve sleep quality. The use of an oil diffuser, with scents such as lavender and peppermint, have proved successful.

advice.1: Consider reducing your caffeine intake to minimize the dependancy cycle. Use decaf coffee, if you would still like to enjoy the taste.
advice.2: Mild dehydration can often lead to fatigue, so make sure to drink plenty of water throughout the day.
advice.3: Try to set aside som personal time throughout the week, just to relax. A hectic work or social life is not always sustainable.
advice.4: Eat smaller meals, more frequently, to maintain a steady blood sugar level. Helping you avoid feeling sluggish after those large meals.
advice.5: Physical activity will not only promote better sleep but can also stress levels. Two major factors in combatting fatigue.

advice.1: Practice mindfulness or meditation, even for very short periods. This can help to boost your mood and reduce feelings of anxiety.
advice.2: Use deep breathing when you are feeling stressed. Inhale through the nose slowly, hold for a few seconds, and exhale slowly through the mouth.
advice.3: Spend some time in nature if possible. Parks, forests, and gardens, can all improve mental well-being.
advice.4: Cuddling has been shown to be highly effective in reducing stress. A loved one, pet, or teddy bear, can all help us release oxytocin.
advice.5: Try to start developing positive self-talk. Self-criticism and self-doubt will only fuel your stress.

advice.1: Always ensure that you are warming up appropriately before exercise. Increasing muscle temperature is crucial to optimal performance.
advice.2: Daily mobility and stretching exercises are very important. Focus on the major joints; ankles, hips, and shoulders.
advice.3: Foam rolling or massages will promote myofascial release. Loosening up restricted movements and reducing pain.
advice.4: Avoid spending for extended periods of time. Try to get up and move for one or two minutes, every half hour.
advice.5: Have a soak in the bath, using epsom salts. Magnesium is absorbed through the skin, relaxing the muscles.

advice.1: Set yourself some goals that are specific, measurable, and achievable. This will provide you with a 'why' to focus on.
advice.2: Do something. It doesn't matter how small or menial the task is, like doing the dishes. You need to get the ball rolling.
advice.3: Find somebody to hold you accountable. Having somebody to pick you up on those down days can be a huge help.
advice.4: Build yourself a music playlist. Listen to it when you're showering, commuting, or working out.
advice.5: Practice grattitude by journalling or saying outloud, some things that you are grateful for each morning.
